title: FRQ Score
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

General Considerations:

The response must correctly define legislative independence.

For Task A, the response must correctly define a political concept, system, institution type, process, or policy.

For Task B, the response must correctly describe two different examples of a political concept, system, institution type, process, or policy, each one within/used by a different AP Comparative Government and Politics course country. Tasks B1 and B2 represent the description for each example/country.

For Task C, for each of the two AP Comparative Government and Politics course countries described in Task B, explain the implications of a similarity or difference of the political concept, system, institution type, process, or policy. Tasks C1 and C2 represent the explanation for each implication/country.

The points for Task C cannot be earned if the corresponding points for Task B are not earned.
descriptions: The response accomplishes none of the five of the tasks set by the question. [NOTE: The points for Task C cannot be earned if the corresponding points for Task B are not earned.]
The response accomplishes one of the tasks set by the question. [NOTE: The points for Task C cannot be earned if the corresponding points for Task B are not earned.]
The response accomplishes two of the tasks set by the question. [NOTE: The points for Task C cannot be earned if the corresponding points for Task B are not earned.]
The response accomplishes three of the tasks set by the question. [NOTE: The points for Task C cannot be earned if the corresponding points for Task B are not earned.]
The response accomplishes four of the tasks set by the question. [NOTE: The points for Task C cannot be earned if the corresponding points for Task B are not earned.]
The response accomplishes all five of the tasks set by the question. [NOTE: The points for Task C cannot be earned if the corresponding points for Task B are not earned.]
